basics.name: Drew Ayling
basics.label: DevOps Connoisseur, Python Enthusiast, System Architect
basics.summary: Experienced Software Engineer with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Skilled in DevOps, Software Architecture, Automated Software Testing, Software Delivery, and Compliance Testing. Core values in product focused delivery and bridging communication gaps between development, quality, release, and support in Enterprise agile environments. Likes the feel of startups. macOS/Linux guy that runs WSL if I must. Python Developer that used to dabble in C++, Perl, and JS. DevOps is for the enterprise and for the developer. Believer in delivering value to customers, whether internal or external. I love spending my days helping people.

work.summary: Working with customers and partners in our open-source community to produce and maintain CircleCI ecosystem assets.
DevOps Architect for the NetApp/SoldFire AFA and HCI product. Automation Architect.
highlights: Architected transition of 1000+ test cases from legacy framework to new automated CI driven testing framework.
Architected new continuous integration and delivery process to parallelize system value delivery, remove circular dependencies and decreased build and test time by a factor of 4.
Architected end to end container and Kubernetes based serverless testing solution for disparate disconnected system tests that removed hundreds of manual hours for each release.
Coached other system architects in scaled agile best practices to enable predictable planning by reducing lead time in exploration phase by 75%.

Architected organizational value stream alignment with other system architects and SAFe practitioners to restructure the teams around value in order to increase delivery to the customer by a factor of 6.

work.summary: Started at SolidFire pre-acquisition, seeing the changes of small start-up to large enterprise from a test automation engineer's pespective
highlights: Led software test team in developing complex automated tests and test cases for core SolidFire product features in python and pytest
Scrum master, architect and product owner for re-architecture of internal legacy automation python code base
Automated systems administration tasks such as system monitoring, report generation, code deployment, package management, and server maintenance
Designed and developed REST API SDK for external test case management software for use across multiple teams.

work.summary: Continued standards developement and began taking leadership oppurtunities within the project space.
highlights: Assisted in standards development for a SOAP / UDP-multicast / UDP-syslog based communications architecture for US Army ground combat vehicles known as VICTORY
Software team lead for the Armyâ€™s Industry Network Integration Evaluation Demonstration to provide VICTORY Capabilities in an operational environment
Project Manager for a $50k internal research project to develop cost effective, micro embedded VICTORY adapters

work.summary: First position post graduation. Worked to test and integrate boost/libqt C++ code base and real systems on vehicles.
highlights: Led software validation experiments developing software components to demonstrate VICTORY Specifications.
Assisted in system integration for US Army field demo of situation awareness vehicle
Assistant project manager and engineer for a combat vehicle high performance video bus architecture.

work.summary: High voltage and GaN substrate applied research

volunteer.summary: Event volunteer and tech support volunteer
Volunteered at multiple science fairs judging Math, Engineering, and Computer Science projects.
